body:
Hello Avicadians, and welcome to the official MusicBot Thread!                                                          

At this thread, you can post your musicplaylists, I will check the songs, and if it gets accepted then it will come into the MusicBot's playlist!

You don't know what a MusicBot is?
It's pretty simple. A teamspeak client/bot which is playing music 24/7, in a very high quality. It does not need a good internet connection, therefore it's better if you join the MusicBot's Room instead of listening the same song on YouTube (if you have weak internet connection), because there is only sound being streamed, and no pictures. You can join the MusicBot's channel if you want to listen to the music at any time! (Expect Avicus TS or MB is offline)

MusicBot admins can manage the bot here: http://bot.atdit.de/

═════════════════════════════════════════════════
Music Playlists in rotation:
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
MusicBot Default Playlist [PL00] [LINK NOT UPDATED, CHECK THREAD UPDATES]
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
Server & TeamSpeak Client Specs:
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
CPU: N/A w/ 6 vCores
RAM: 4GB
OS: Debian 8.0 64x
Connection Down/Up (mbps): About 100
DDoS Protection: 550GB/s
Official unique ID: N/A
Security level: N/A
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
F.A.Q: (Questions and answers)
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
Q: Where can I see the name of the song which is currently being streamed?
A: Simply double click the MusicBot and send him: !playing - The bot will send you a private message with the song name!

Q: The MusicBot is too loud! What can I do?
A: You can change the volume easily. Right click the MusicBot and click on 'Change Volume', then customize it as you like. Note: +6 dB will make the music quality worse

Q: What can I do if the current music isn't my flavour?
A: The only solutions is: Suggest better songs :P

Q: Is this bot really 24/7?
A: Actually yes, but for some reason it stops playing sometimes. If the MusicBot isn't playing, you should contact me. Thanks

Questions?
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
Ask them below!


The first official day with MusicBot:

:)

The current version of the MusicBot: 5.1

At this thread, you can post your musicplaylists, I will check the songs, and if it gets accepted then it will come into the MusicBot's playlist!

You don't know what a MusicBot is?
It's pretty simple. A teamspeak client/bot which is playing music 24/7, in a very high quality. It does not need a good internet connection, therefore it's better if you join the MusicBot's Room instead of listening the same song on YouTube (if you have weak internet connection), because there is only sound being streamed, and no pictures. You can join the MusicBot's channel if you want to listen to the music at any time! replies.body:
═════════════════════════════════════════════════
UPDATE 3.1 - !playing
═════════════════════════════════════════════════

-Added commands!

Anonymous usage

!register <nickname>
Registers a new user bound to the TeamSpeak-Account you are using. This account has no privileges by default but can be edited by the bot administrators.
!playing
Display the currently playing song

Authorized users

The icons represent the required permissions. (Staff)


!password <value>
change your password to <value>)
!next
playback the next track (only when a playlist is active)
!prev
playback the previous track (only when a playlist is active)
!search <searchstring>
 or 
search for tracks
!play <searchstring/uuid>
playback a track by its id or search for a track and playback the first match
!queue <searchstring/uuid>
enqueue a track by its id or search for a track and enqueue the first match
!queuenext <searchstring/uuid>
prepend a track by its id or search for a track and prepend the first match to the queue
!stop
stop playback
!volume up
increase the volume
!volume down
decrease the volume
!volume <value>
set the volume to <value> (between 0 and 100)
!playlist <playlistname>
starts playing back the playlist <playlistname>
!stream <url>
stream from <url>; this may be http-streams like shoutcast / icecast or just remote soundfiles
!yt <url>
playback an <url> via external youtube-dl (if enabled); beware: the file will be downloaded first and played back afterwards, so there might be a slight delay before playback starts
!ytdl <url>
playback an <url> via external youtube-dl (if enabled); beware: the file will be downloaded first and played back afterwards, so there might be a slight delay before playback starts; additionally, the file will be stored
!shuffle
toggle shuffle
!repeat
toggle repeat

-Fixed a few problems of music lag.

-Using SinusBot now

I hope you guys are happy with the ability to request the song name!

Greets,
Atdit
